notes.context: Used when calculator does not capture loan type during input. Refined loan type benchmarks can be applied once user provides loan type at save time.

eligibility.max_tenure_notes: Banks typically cap home loan tenures ~30 years; longer tenures may be rare and depend on age and policy.
Personal loans are commonly capped around 5-7 years depending on lender and profile.

tax.notes: FD interest is generally taxable as per slab; some issuers may deduct TDS based on thresholds.

risk.notes: SIP returns are not guaranteed; benchmarks are for expectation-setting, not advice.

tax.notes: Tax treatment depends on rules, tenure, and withdrawal conditions.

loan_high_roi.title: High interest rate vs market
loan_high_roi.body: Your rate of {input}% is higher than the market median of {median}%.

loan_tenure_unrealistic.title: Tenure looks unrealistic
loan_tenure_unrealistic.body: A tenure of {input} years is uncommon for this loan type. Typical max is {max} years.

tenure_trap.title: Tenure increases total interest sharply
tenure_trap.body: At {input} years, you may pay ~{ratio}x of principal as interest (depends on rate).

prepayment_opportunity.title: Small prepayment can save years
prepayment_opportunity.body: Paying 1 extra EMI/year could reduce tenure by ~{years_saved} years.

high_roi_investment.title: Return assumption looks unusually high
high_roi_investment.body: Caution: {input}% is unusually high. Ensure you understand the risk and issuer credibility.

inflation_warning.title: Inflation reduces real returns
inflation_warning.body: Your real return after {inflation}% inflation is only ~{real_return}%.
